definition: to go off the stage/to fall from position of prestige/to step down (from office etc)/to disentangle oneself/to get off the hook
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Collect leave, younger sister of your Cheng Yi does not have face very much, step down a stage in anger.
sentences.chinese: 罗的离去，令程伊妹很没面子，愤然走下台去。

sentences.english: Try to avoid running down the steps, the impact is too large, small step slow.
sentences.chinese: 尽量避免跑下台阶，这个冲击太大，小步缓行。

sentences.english: He declared again, and he went down the steps.
sentences.chinese: 他又说了几句，然后才走下台阶。

sentences.english: Pressure mounts on Japan PM Mori to step down.
sentences.chinese: 要求日相森喜朗下台压力日渐升高。

sentences.english: But Assad shows no sign of heeding their calls for him to step down.
sentences.chinese: 但是没有迹象显示阿萨德会响应他们的号召下台。

sentences.english: The prime minister of japan changed again this week.
sentences.chinese: 本周日本首相再度易人，鸠山下台，菅直人上台。

sentences.english: A special election would be held to fill out Wu's term if he were to step down.
sentences.chinese: 阿将举行特别选举，以填补了吴的任期，如果他下台。

sentences.english: As for anything about the post-Gaddafi situation, we have not addressed that point.
sentences.chinese: 至于卡扎菲下台后的状况，我们还无暇顾及。

sentences.english: The audience hooted off the speaker.
sentences.chinese: 听众把演讲者轰下台来。

sentences.english: The audience groaned the speaker down.
One of Kenya's leading churchmen has called on the government to resign.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼亚一位高级宗教人士要求政府下台。

sentences.english: He will be hooted off the stage sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 他早晚得让人给轰下台。

sentences.english: The meeting also resolved to keep up the pressure for Colonel Qaddafi to quit.
sentences.chinese: 会议也决定了要继续向卡扎非施加压力，逼迫其下台。

sentences.english: In the confusion, Han Weisong slipped and fell down the steps and soon cut off gas.
sentences.chinese: 一片混乱中，韩伟松失足滚下台阶，很快就断了气。

sentences.english: However, a large number of two class gathered in palace noble yoo sung-ryong to step down.
sentences.chinese: 然而，大批两班贵族齐聚宫外一致要求柳成龙下台。

definition: to rise to power (in politics)/to go on stage (in the theater)
to overthrow/downfall/to fall from power/to go bankrupt
prime minister (of Japan or UK etc)
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
